ygData.subject: HTTP Extended Headers (When, where, and how should they be used?)
ygData.msgSnippet: In reading the literature on RESTful interfaces, I ve noticed that some people use Extended (or non-standard) HTTP Headers.  Interface versioning seems to be

Subject: HTTP Extended Headers (When, where, and how should they be used?)
X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=584683; y=Mu9rHSYuSLXJgwE_mkGyZNKH-DzMjVQHU9faB13-vzxao2fNHw

In reading the literature on RESTful interfaces, I've noticed that some peo=
ple use Extended (or non-standard) HTTP Headers.  Interface versioning seem=
s to be one popular use..   Other than recent RFC drafts concerning the sug=
gestion to no longer use the "X-" prefix, very little else is written.

Cle=
arly, one could get carried with Extended Headers, however they do have the=
ir uses.  I'm curious to hear people's opinions and guidelines on how, wher=
e, and under what situations to use Extended Headers within REST.
